comments.body: do we handle negatives of these? (IIRC that's on one of the issues)

I didn't change the behavior of negativity, and the question is *how* to handle it.  One of the only references I can find regarding the expected behavior is [this comment](https://github.com/moment/moment/issues/2408#issuecomment-110180010), which also seems to indicate it's not very well defined in the ISO 8601 standard.  How would you feel about pulling that out into a separate issue?

yes pls create a separate issue. only thing for now is do we raise if a negative is passed in? (i think we should unless / until we decide on how to handle it), though isn't the result just negative of the Timedelta itself which is well defined.

Ok, will do.  

No, nothing is raised when it is negative, and the behavior is, admittedly, quite odd, i.e.

`"P-6DT0H50M3.010010012S"` parses as `Timedelta(
                days=-6,
                minutes=50,
                seconds=3,
                milliseconds=10,
                microseconds=10,
                nanoseconds=12,
            )`
, and the negative is only allowed right after the P descriptor.  A negative in any other position will raise an error.  As far as I can tell, there are two possibilities to go here:

- only support an overall "-" e.g. `"-P6DT1H" = Timedelta('-7 days +23:00:00')` and/or
- support positive/negative on each, e.g. `"P7DT-1H3M" = Timedelta('6 days 23:03:00')`
Issue now here: #37172.  I would prefer to change/update the negativity behavior in a separate PR if that's ok.
yep that's great. well scoped PRs are good. one thing at a time. and thanks for working on this.

comments.body: try in the invalid test with a single '-' and '-P' which i don't think are valid

Added `'P'` and `'-P'`, but not `'-'` since it is not an ISO string (these start with `'P'` or `'-P'`) and therefore not parsed with `parse_iso_format_string`. 

Moreover, on master `pd.Timedelta('-')` does not raises an error and gives back `Timedelta('0 days 00:00:00')`
well that's an issue. can you add that test case and fix that as well.
Sure, will make another PR for that issue this week.
@jreback, created an issue and I am now working on a fix. Do you want to proceed with this PR or do you want to put it on hold till the issue is resolved?
